name: FORTIGATE DLP [File Detected]
description: Fortinet Fortigate Unified Threat Management DLP events that were not blocked and are not whitelisted. Review filename and destination domain, may be potential exfil of sensitive data either by attacker or by insider threat.
query: class:fortinet_fortigate action!:`block` category:[`utm-dlp`,`utm:dlp`] severity=warning has:filename NOT (dstdomain:`akamai.com` filename=`ncsi.txt`) NOT (dstdomain:`fortinet.com` filename:`fdsupdate`) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: FORTIGATE UTM [Risky Mimetype from DDNS]
description: This rule looks for a potentially risky mime type received from a dynamic DNS (DDNS) site. This could indicate a malicious payload being delivered. DDNS sites can be used for legitimate purposes, but have also been used by threat actors to deliver malware for C2 purposes. This rule is limited to Fortinet UTM Web Filter events.

name: EXPLOIT - FORTINET [CVE-2022-41328]
description: This rule looks for attempts to exploit a vulnerability in Fortinet Fortigate devices, reported as CVE-2022-41328. This is a path traversal vulnerability that allows an attacker to upload arbitrary files to Fortigate Devices at the path specified in the exploit.
query: class:fortinet* (msg:&[`upload-icon`,`../../../`] OR msg:`execute wireless-controller hs20-icon upload-icon`) NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: FORTINET FORTIGATE [Script Deployed]
description: This rule looks for scripts being deployed in Fortinet Fortigate devices. This was observed in the exploitation attempts of vulnerability CVE-2022-41328, where threat actors deployed scripts to FortiGate devices and used them in exploitation. If this rule triggers an alert, verify the legitimacy of this activity.
